title: Whitestone Strategic : Secretive  No  consultants got taxpayer cash
body_text:
SPEAK UP
Taxpayers paid $134,750 to a firm behind the No campaign in the Voice to Parliament called Whitestone Strategic, documents that Guardian Australia FOI’d show. It invoiced Coalition Senators Jacinta Nampijinpa Price (at least $68,805), Claire Chandler ($34,676) and Alex Antic ($27,639), former senator Amanda Stoker ($3,300) and shadow defence spokesperson Andrew Hastie ($330). None of them responded when the paper asked what Whitestone provided them, but Chandler has before said that his invoice wasn’t related to the Voice.
